methods.handleException:
Notify the listener that an exception was encountered while initiating or maintaining the subscription. Delivery
 of an exception implies that the subscription is no longer valid. This might happen during subscription
 establishment, and consequently should be checked for after subscribe completes.

:param exception: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.locations.TableDataException) - The exception
methods.handleTableLocationKey:
Notify the listener of a TableLocationKey encountered while initiating or maintaining the location
 subscription. This should occur at most once per location, but the order of delivery is not
 guaranteed.

:param tableLocationKey: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.locations.ImmutableTableLocationKey) - The new table location key
methods.processPending:
Subscribe if needed, and return any pending location keys (or throw a pending exception) from the table location
 provider. A given location key will only be returned by a single call to processPending() (unless state is
 reset). No order is maintained internally. If a pending exception is thrown, this signals that the subscription
 is no longer valid and no subsequent location keys will be returned.

:return: (java.util.Collection<io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.locations.ImmutableTableLocationKey>) The collection of pending location keys
methods.reset: Unsubscribe and clear any state pending processing.

text: Intermediates between push-based subscription to a TableLocationProvider and polling on update source refresh.
